intro: Alloplectus lindenii, commonly known as the Lindens' spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color and bloom in the spring. Alloplectus lindenii is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance.
